xdeint_intr.c File Reference

Detailed Description

This code contains interrupt related functions of Xilinx Video Deinterlacer (DEINT) device driver. Please see xdeint.h for more details of the driver.

 MODIFICATION HISTORY:

 Ver    Who     Date      Changes
 ----- ---- -------- -------------------------------------------------------
 1.00a rjh 07/10/11 First release
 2.00a rjh 18/01/12 Updated for v_deinterlacer 2.00

#include "xdeint.h"
#include "xil_assert.h"

Functions

void XDeint_IntrHandler (void *InstancePtr)
int XDeint_SetCallBack (XDeint *InstancePtr, void *CallBackFunc)

Function Documentation

void XDeint_IntrHandler (  void *  InstancePtr  ) 
 

This function is the interrupt handler for the Deinterlacer

This handler reads the pending interrupt from the IER/ISR, determines the source of the interrupts, calls according callback, and finally clears the interrupts.

The application is responsible for connecting this function to the interrupt system. Application beyond this driver is also responsible for providing callbacks to handle interrupts and installing the callbacks using XDeint_SetCallBack() during initialization phase. An example delivered with this driver demonstrates how this could be done.

Parameters:
InstancePtr is a pointer to the XDeint instance that just interrupted.
Returns:
None.
Note:
The Error interrupt callback invoked in case an error interrupt or spurious interrupt happens should reset the DEINT device that just interrupted.

int XDeint_SetCallBack (  XDeint *  InstancePtr,
void *  CallBackFunc
) 
 

This routine installs an asynchronous callback function.

Parameters:
InstancePtr is a pointer to the XDeint instance to be worked on.
CallbackFunc is the address of the callback function.
Returns:
  • XST_SUCCESS when handler is installed.
  • XST_INVALID_PARAM when HandlerType is invalid.
Note:
Invoking this function for a handler that already has been installed replaces it with the new handler.
